Summary Heading: A Bit of Home Away From Home

I've had the opportunity to try all of the ESA's in Orange County, and the Yorba Linda ESA has become my favorite. All of the ESA's are physically identical. But like snowflakes, each ESA is unique unto itself. Beginning with location, there's an ESA for the beach, Newport ESA and Fountain Valley ESA. North County has Brea ESA. Mid County is Irvine ESA. East County is Yorba Linda ESA, Anaheim Hills ESA, and Orange County East ESA. West County has Cypress ESA. I selected Yorba Linda ESA because of its remoteness.

It's location is a bit confusing at first as the roads in the vicinity are a bit unusual. And lastly, the rooms are a bit dated. The bedding is very old and the wall coverings are very outdated. Summary: My family and I stayed at this hotel for a basketball tournament during the Memorial Day weekend and we loved it!! The area is located in an upscale area, easy accessible to dining and shopping which we took advantage of and the room was spotless and very comfortable. Desiree, at the front desk greeted us with a smile and was exceptionally friendly. The fact that she shared with us her commute to work each day to make us out -of - towners feel at home shows her dedication. I would definitely give this hotel a high rating!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing a wonderful review of your visit to Extended Stay America - Orange County - Yorba Linda. Our goal is to make your stay as comfortable as possible and to assist you with whatever you need, so it's nice to know our team accomplished this during your visit. We are also delighted that you loved our convenient location, as well as your well-kept accommodation. It was great to have you here, and we look forward to your next stay with us soon. Summary: Chose this motel for the rate. It is clean but could use a little more attention in some areas, like the windows. They were quite dirty. And the sink faucet in the kitchenette leaked. Drip, drip, drip. The exterior looks good and the rooms are a decent size. The bed was okay. The bathroom was small but clean. The shower worked well. There are no amenities, however, except soap and shampoo. I had forgotten my hair dryer so I was disappointed that the motel didn't provide one.   The kitchenette had no dishes but you can request them. Only one wastebasket in the entire room. No door on the closet. A desk and one small table, each with a chair, were adequate. Everything was quiet except we could really hear the guests walking around above us.   Breakfast wasn't really breakfast;

Our goal is to provide a great experience for our guests with clean, comfortable and well-maintained suites and excellent service, all in a safe environment, so we apologize we fell short. Since our suites are designed for guests staying multiple nights desiring home-like living, these guests often bring their own bath amenities such as hairdryers and toiletries. Summary: Our stay was excellent!  The manager, Gigi,  went above & beyond to help us coordinate our visit & make other reservations.  She is a star!  Benny was also very attentive to both our hotel needs and other completely unrelated activities.   The two made the visit extraordinary. .

I especially like Dessere and Gigi These people know what they're doing.  I would recommend staying here, my room is clean and plenty of towels.

Summary Heading: Great Location- Ideal for Longer Stays!
Summary: We stayed a week over the Christmas break and this hotel was perfect. The full kitchen allowed us to bring food to prepare so we weren't eating out every meal. Breakfast is provided- grab & go style. There is no gym or pool, which I would say is the biggest downfall, but we did laps around the beautiful property and stretched/used resistance bands. Lots of restaurants & shopping nearby and close to parks, movie theater, and the Richard Nixon Library. Hollywood and Knotts Berry Farm were not too far down the highway. We would definitely stay here again if in the area!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay.  Please accept our apologies that our amenities were not to your expectations. The best I got was warm, which sucked because I woke up FREEZING thanks to the cold air leaking in through the windows and I tried to warm up in the shower, but no joy.   Never a staff member at the desk.  It's an average hotel. Good location. Average room.

Check-in – We arrived quite late (after 11pm) at the end of a long day, and upon giving our name to the desk clerk, were told that he had our reservation…for three rooms! Summary: I don't understand all the negative reviews.  I loved my time here.  The staff went out of their way to assist whenever I needed something.  But residents need to realize that this is not your usual hotel.  There are a lot of people living here long-term who have been displaced from their homes and/or jobs.  Yes, there were maintenance issues now and then.  The maintenance man fixed whatever I asked him to.  Yes, there were loud guests on weekends.  That's why the police supervise when necessary.  No, there is no pool or gym here.  Guests should already know that when they book their rooms or ask ahead of time.  I'm grateful this place even existed and am sorry to read the bad reviews.  If you're looking for the Ritz, then this is not the place for you.  Thanks, ESA YL staff,

Summary: Having only stayed at an Extended Stay once, back in October of 2013 over in Phoenix, AZ. I had a bad impression going into my stay. The bad reviews on top of the now distant memories of mold, clogged sinks, and hard beds really had my expectations low on what to expect. In fact, I only chose this location because due to my bad experience I had a free night voucher I had to use up.
